channel.title: DCR-DVD608 - cannot figure out how to get it onto the comp
channel.description:
I am quite new to using Video cameras and am having alot of trouble with mine.
I recently borrowed someones DCR-DVD608. There is no manual, and i cannot for the life of me get my movie onto the computer for editing.
All i am able to do is 'Finalize' the disk, allowing me to either view it on the comp thru the camera, or put the disk into the computer and view it there.
Neither of these have an option i can find that allows me to get my movie onto the actual computer for editing.
Any help would be most appreciated

item.title: DCR-DVD608 - cannot figure out how to get it onto the comp
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

i fucking hate the internet… never find what i wanna find on this fucking thing.

I cannot find a convertor that i can find serial numbers for.
DVD Converter Platinum

seems to be the best one but fucked if i can find a full version that i can access without paying for… i can find downloads to the full versions… but i fucking have to pay to sign up to download the fucking thing…

The internet gives me headaches…

Read full topic

item.title: DCR-DVD608 - cannot figure out how to get it onto the comp
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

.VOB is not a weird format.

Maybe try a torrent, or download a trial and find the serial number?

item.title: DCR-DVD608 - cannot figure out how to get it onto the comp
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

ok ive extracted it onto my computer but its in a weird format.

.VOB

i need a convertor to make it into a real movie file that i can muck around with in Windows Movie Maker.

I downloaded like 7 of them and every single one only does up to 5 mins of footage…

Anyone know of a real one i can use?

Read full topic
